event.title: Welcome
event.content: Hello %prename%, good to talk to you! I hope you had a good flight and I am glad that you accepted this job offer. We chose you because of your long-term international project experience. This is a huge project for our company. This is why you have to put all efforts into bringing it to a successful end. You will find out about all the necessary details as soon as you arrive at the client's site in Houston. The customer's project manager, Miss Oaks, will pick you up at the airport. I wish you all the best for the project. I don't think that I have to remind you of this project's and that it is also a huge opportunity for you and your career. Don't disappoint me!
event.option: Next

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Pick up by client
event.content: Hi %prename%, my name is Jessica Oaks but you can call me Jessie. I am the project leader at Concrete Machinery. Did you have a pleasant flight?
event.option: Hi, nice to meet you. Yes, it was a great flight and I am looking forward to finally start the project!
Hello Miss Oaks. Yes, the flight was okay.
Hi Jessie, the flight was okay but they only served American food. I did not like that at all!
Pleasant? It was horrible. I could not get any sleep, as I am so nervous about the project!

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Pick up by client
event.content: Awesome. I am very excited about the project as well. So let's drive to the office and get started right away.
event.option: Next

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Pick up by client
event.content: Great. I know you Germans are pretty formal but you can really call me Jessy! So come on, let's drive to the office.
event.option: Next

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Pick up by client
event.content: I hope that you will get used to it! Let's drive to the office to start with the project.
event.option: Next

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Pick up by client
event.content: I thought that you have great experience with such projects. I hope there will be no reason to be nervous about. Let's drive to the office to start with the project!
event.option: Next

event.option: Next

event.content: You may connect your computer to our network now and use the internet. I have already sent you an email containing the project charter.
event.option: Next

event.subject: Project charter
event.content:
Dear %gender% %surname%,
enclosed please kindly find the project charter.
BR,
Jessie

event.subject: Project details
event.content:
Dear %gender% %surname%,
I hope that you already got to know the people involved in the project. Did you manage to talk to Miss Oaks and get the final details about the project? I would appreciate to be kept up-to-date about the project objectives and status.
Kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: Hello %prename%, thank you for calling! Did you already choose an assistant?
event.option: Yes, my assistant is Bimal Jones.
Yes, my assistant is Nadja Schuster.
Yes, my assistant is Martin Heinemann
No, I don’t need an assistant. I can handle things my on my own.

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: Okay, great! I think that was a good choice.
event.option: Next

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: Sorry %prename%. As your boss I have to disagree. You have to focus on your main tasks!
event.option: Next

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: What do you think is the main intention of the project?
event.option: To implement software that supports the maintenance and planning of all integrated processes of a company. The whole creation of value within a company can be planned with this which will help us produce and work at our best. [ERP]
To implement software that helps to maintain and support the procurement process of a company. The close connection to suppliers might be a great chance to decrease the company’s cost. [SRM]

To implement software that supports the interaction of a company with its current and future customers. This can improve the relationship to customers which might result in satisfying sales numbers. [CRM]
Sorry, I don’t know about the project’s intention.

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: That’s different from what I have discussed with the customer. Maybe you should look at the project charter again!
event.option: Next

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: Okay, it seems like you understood the intention of the project, great!
event.option: Next

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: And how about the benefits?
event.option: To raise the efficiency of involved business processes and strengthen the relationship to the customers to raise the customers’ loyalty in order to gain a long-term advantage in competition.
To increase the productivity in all manufacturing processes in order to be able to increase the product outcome. This should reduce fixed charges.
To strengthen the relationship to the supplier of Concrete Machinery and optimize the procurement process.
There are no benefits involved.

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: That sounds worthwhile. The benefits are really important to convince the customer expanding its business with us!
event.option: Next

event.title: Call with CEO
event.content: Please look at the project charter again to get more information about the benefits. These ones are really important in order to convince the customer to expand its business with us!
event.option: Next

event.title: Additional CRM information
event.content: Thank you %prename% for your short update on the current matter. To get a better impression of the project topic, here are some brief facts about CRM. Enjoy the project and keep on working hard!
event.option: Next

event.subject: Important! Risk Analysis
event.content:
Dear %prename%,
did you already think of the tools of project management? For example the risk analysis is very important for this project and needs to be done as quickly as possible!
Keep in mind how the risk matrix is arranged – Please find an example in the attachment section.
Please go to the office to perform the risk analysis and check your mail afterwards.
Kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann

Kind regards,

event.subject: Re: Important! Risk Analysis
event.content:
Dear %prename%,
Thanks for your risk analysis. You did a great job on that one!
After accessing the possible risks, please also make sure to provide necessary measurements for those.
Kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann

event.title: Auswahl
event.description:
Dear Mr. Zimmermann,
Please find below the necessary measurements for the major risks.
Kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann
event.option:
Use an agile project management approach such as Scrum.
This enables us to adapt new requirements easily and to encourage frequent, regularly communication with the customer. Regarding time concerns we should implement enough time buffers within the project schedule and provide a well structured project plan as well as a precise budged plan.

Always displaying a forecast of the daily traffic jam to prevent loss of time for the team members. Using an sequential project management approach such as the waterfall model. This enables us to document the project steps in detail and assures a static process.

Use an incremental project management approach such as the spiral model. This way the time on documenting can be kept low and the customer is periodically involved. By executing this method the project manager does not need a well structured plan. To prevent defect printers we provide regular maintenance on them.

event.subject: Re: Important! Risk Analysis Measurements
event.content:
Dear %prename%,
Great job! I think you are really the perfect Project Manager for this project.
All measurements are right! Keep this work up.
Kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann

event.subject: Re: Important! Risk Analysis
event.content:
Dear %prename%,
I think you should review your decision. The measurements are good but there are some measurements missing. I completed them for you. Please check them below.
Use an agile project management approach such as Scrum. This enables us to adapt new requirements easily and to encourage frequent, regularly communication with the customer. Regarding time concerns we should implement enough time buffers within the project schedule and provide a well structured project plan as well as a precise budged plan.
Kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann

event.subject: Important! Resource and Budged Planning
event.content:
Dear %prename%,
A project is a collaborative process, frequently involving research or design that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim. A well planed project saves time, money and also evaluates unforeseen problems that may occur in the given activity. A plan is a guide that will help you as a Project Manager.
Planning allows you to find the critical path. It allows you to balance the cost, schedule and resources to be most effective. It allows you to set milestones and effectively track the progress.
It is now the time to plan the budget for our CRM Project. In the following activity you need to calculate the resources for the project. Please note the amount for each phase in order to calculate the final amount of costs for the project.
Good luck and kind regards,
Thomas Zimmermann

event.title: Kickoff reminder
event.content: Hey %prename%, the kick off meeting will start at 9 o' clock. I just wanted to remind you!

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Kickoff meeting
event.content: Just as I expected! You Germans are always so punctual. Welcome to our meeting. Please tell me, how is the project going so far?
event.option: We have identified a lot of risks. I hope that we can overcome those obstacles anyway.
Today's kick off meeting is really important for me since I haven't really understood the benefits of this project.
We are on track. I think that we can manage the project in time.
You have to ask my assistant about that. I personally didn't have much time to elaborate the project.

event.partner: Jessica Oaks, project leader at Concrete Machinery
event.title: Kick off meeting
event.content: Seems like you are not very passionate about the project. Well, you should be though! It is really important for our company.
event.option: Next

event.subject: India
event.content:
Hi %prename%,
I hope the last couple of weeks went well for you and you enjoy the US!
I am a little concerned about our project’s progress since I haven’t heard anything from our Indian colleagues. Maybe you could check what’s going on?
Thanks and best regards,
Jessica

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Avi Gupta speaking?
event.option: Hi Avi. This is %gender% %surname%.
Hello Mr. Gupta, this is %gender% %surname%.
Hello Mr. Gupta, this is %gender% %surname%. Glad you finally answered your phone…
Glad I could reach you! This is %gender% %surname%.

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Oh, hello %gender% %surname%. How are you doing?
event.option: I’m fine, thanks for asking. And you?
Doesn’t matter. We have to get to work.
Very good, thanks. How is the Bangalore summer?
It’s okay, thanks. How about you?

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Oh… What can I do for you?
event.option: I was wondering about the progress of our project.
Our client is concerned with the progress of our project.
Is there anything you want to tell me about the progress of our project?
Is the project in trouble?

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: It’s hot as always, but we are doing fine. How do you like the US?
event.option: Such an interesting country. I like it!
I’m getting fed up with burgers, but I like it.
The people here are really nice!
It’s great to finally work on an international project.

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Wonderful. How can I help you today?
event.option: I was wondering about the progress of our project.
Our client is concerned with the progress of our project.
Is there anything you want to tell me about the progress of our project?
Is the project in trouble?

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: The project is doing fine. My colleagues and I are very optimistic.
event.option: Does that mean we are on schedule?
I’m glad to hear that. Keep up the good work!
Do you need any additional help?
What exactly does that mean?

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: There is no trouble.
event.option: Does that mean we are on schedule?
I’m glad to hear that. Keep up the good work!
Do you need any additional help?
…but?

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Well, we did run into some trouble…but it’s nothing we cannot fix.
event.option: I’m glad to hear that. Keep up the good work!
What kind of trouble are you talking about?
Are you sure you can fix it on your own?
I will leave things in your capable hands then.

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: There have been minor issues with our servers… but I have assigned my best people to the task. They will fix it.
event.option: Can they fix it in time?
Do you need additional help?
I’m glad to hear that. Keep up the good work!
I hope so. Tell them to do extra hours if necessary. Bye!

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: I assure you, we are working as hard as we can. But maybe a few additional hands would not hurt…
event.option: In that case, I will give you the budget to hire a few more people.
I could send over a few experts from Germany if you think that’s helpful.
I am afraid our budget allows no further hands.
I don’t think so. You created a problem, you will fix it yourself. Even if that means extra hours for your team. Goodbye!

event.subject: We have a problem!!!
event.content:
Dear %gender% %surname%,
I followed up on our colleagues’ activities in India. The results are not what I expected.
First of all, they are still behind the schedule. But what’s worse, it seems like our plan to make them do extra hours backfired and quality has suffered:
* The system crashes frequently
* Not all required data fields have been implemented
I think that we need to talk to Mrs. Oaks on how to fix this.
Regards,
NAME ASSISTENT

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Yes, I think that would be a big help for us.
event.option: Ok, I’ll see that it gets done.
Or would you prefer if we send someone over?
Ok,I’ll get it done, but I hope this does not happen again.
Ok, that’s fine, but I hope next time you turn to me with your problems earlier.

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Nevermind then. I’m sure we can do it on our own.
event.option: Ok, good bye.
I’m sure you will. Talk to you soon.
That sounds good. Good bye.
Sure. See you later, alligator.

event.title: You call Avi Gupta to find out what is going on in India...
event.content: Okay, that’s great, thank you!

event.subject: We have a problem!!!
event.content:
Dear %gender% %surname%,
I followed up on our colleagues’ activities in India. The results are not what I expected.
We are drastically behind the schedule. Looks like we should have taken a closer look into the progress of the Indian team. They are not even close to finish everything they had in scope for this section of the project.
I took the time to read a little bit about the Indian culture in order to avoid further complications due to cultural differences. What I found out:
In India, it is critical not to lose face in front of others. This may be why Avi told us that everything was going according to plan. It think that he was afraid of telling us the truth and losing face.
My suggestion is that we talk to Ms. Oaks on how to fix this and from now on have a closer look on our colleagues in India.
Regards,
NAME ASSISTENT

We will hire new resources in India to increase our team’s capacity.

event.subject: Feedback on current Status
event.content:
Hello %gender% %surname% ,
Thank you again for the extensive conversation last Thursday. I think it was good that we had this discussion and that we could clarify all these little issues we had. I am very positive about our progress by now and I feel that we are back on track with all of our tasks. I also talked to your assistant on Friday. I appreciate that you invest so much time in informing me about the situation. We should try to keep this close contact from now on. Your assistant also briefed me about the problems you had with the American Government. I am glad that you could fix the visa issue and that we can proceed with the workforce we have. Furthermore I hope that we again have the full support from our clients even if there were some intercultural misunderstandings. As I already mentioned I am very satisfied with the progress of my team. We will conclude the implementation soon, so that we can finally rollout the last components and complete the employee training. The implementation has been quite satisfying so far. There are some minor bugs concerning the customer data. The issuing of invoices does not function perfectly so far. In some cases the address is not generated correctly. Most likely it has something to do with the design of the underlying database. But apart from that, the implementation runs very good and we are about to finish soon. Let me know if you want to discuss the issue again. If not we will hear us soon!
Kind Regards
Avi

event.content:
Hello Mr. Gupta
Thanks for your mail.
event.option:

Kind Regards,
%prename% %surname%

It is highly important that the invoicing functions seamlessly. My assistant will call you soon to discuss the issue so that we can find a solution quickly.
Please keep on informing me about the testing. I am very satisfied so far and I am positive that we can rollout a perfect solution soon.
Kind Regards >br/>
%prename% %surname%

Nice to hear about your progress! I am happy to hear that you have no major problems. We will hear us soon.
Kind Regards,
%prename% %surname%

You just received an Email from the CEO - Thomas Zimmermann, but you don’t have any time to read or answer. He has to work it out on his own. Unfortunately this will have an impact on our time schedule.
This is the first Steering Committee! You are moderating it. Hope you are prepared.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content:
Hello everyone!
Welcome to our first steering Committee Meeting. I am glad that you all found the time to attend this meeting and that we are together right now. As this is our first Steering Committee Meeting I will quickly remind us of the purposes and goals of this Meeting and explain the agenda for this and the upcoming Steering Committee Meetings. During our Steering Committee Meeting all key managers of the project come together and control the realization of the project at the strategic level. This is where we verify the project’s coherence with established aims, and if the project keeps established frames such as range, costs and deadlines. All high-level decisions for the project should be discussed and approved during these meetings. This is our first Steering Committee Meeting and from now on we will meet every three and in urgencies also in between. I am glad that everyone is here and that we have Avi on the phone.
event.option: Avi, can you hear us?

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: Yes, loud and clear!
event.option: That’s great!

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: Ok, well let’s go over the agenda quickly. In the following meetings we will start going over the minutes of the previous meeting, to remind us again of what has happened until then and to obtain everyone’s approval. As our last meeting was the Kick-off Meeting, we won’t go over the minutes today. Following we will discuss the Action List we composed in the last meeting. Afterwards I will give a status report on the project, presenting what has been achieved since the last meeting, announcing the upcoming tasks and illustrating any issues. We continue by discussing the current issues and decide on how to handle potential problems and how to proceed. After that there is time to announce and discuss any other subjects that you want to discuss with the Steering Committee. So that was the agenda.
event.option: Are there any questions?

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: Is there any possibility that we can meet more often than every three month if it is necessary?
event.option: Yes of course there is. If there are any major decisions to make immediately I will organize a Meeting as soon as possible. If any of you has any problems or concerns please inform me about it!
No, that is strictly forbidden. We will just meet three month. Apart from that I think we all are pretty busy so that we won’t have time for more meetings.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: So if there are no more questions, let’s start for today. Here we have the Action List from the Kick-Off Meeting, which contains the tasks for the planning phase. The tasks mainly concern the project management team and I am happy to say that we could complete all tasks.
event.option: I will refer to the task again in the Status Report.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: So if there are no more questions, let’s start for today. Here we have the Action List from the Kick-Off Meeting, which contains the tasks for the planning phase. The tasks mainly concern the project management team and I am happy to say that we could complete all tasks.
event.option: I will refer to the task again in the Status Report.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: So let’s come to the Project Status Report. We just concluded the planning phase of the project, which is about 20% of the project work.
event.option: Until now there are no problems concerning our schedule, budget or the quality.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: Our main achievement from the last month is the clear and confirmed definition of the requirements of the project and the Customer Relationship Management. During several meetings with Concrete Mashinery we discussed their ideas and desires so that we know have a clear image of what is needed. Finally we agreed on the Project Charter for our project. Additionally we did a Stakeholder and Risk Analysis to better understand the circumstances of the project.
event.option: Based on this the project management team did a Milestone and Budget Planning which has also been agreed on with the client.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: With that the planning phase is completed and we can start the execution phase. I am happy to announce that we already have a detailed work-breakdown structure and a detailed time and budget planning so that we can know go on with the Actual State Analysis which will take some weeks’ time. After that we will go over to the Target State Planning, both in tight cooperation with the client.
event.option: I have entered the upcoming tasks in the Action List.

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: As there are currently no issues to discuss, this was it from my side.
event.option: Are there any questions or is there anything you want to discuss?

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: Thanks for the presentation! I am glad to hear that everything goes so well until now. Also from our side there are no issues or problems. I think this cooperation is very productive so far and I feel positive about the project.
event.option: Thanks Jessica!

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: This is nice to hear Jessica. BrillanCRM is also very happy to work together with you and we think our cooperation will be successful!
event.option: Right, Thomas!

event.title: Steering Committee
event.content: Well, thanks everyone for coming! Our next meeting will be the 03rd July, but you are always welcome to contact me if there is anything to discuss!
event.option: See you then!

Your assistant told me that you wanted to talk to me?

I will continue to work on this project together with you.

Alright, next time I will invite you to the next steering comitee meeting.

event.content: You reached your goal and Vance stays on the project. That means the software will have the planned anticipated quality but due to the pay raise the costs will increase.

event.subject: Feedback
event.content:
Hi %prename%,
Good the India-crisis is finally averted! I think we can live with the consequences.
On a similar matter: Your assistant put together a requirement list I needed for Avi to construct the GUI and frankly, it didn’t quite cut it… As this concerns your assistant, I didn’t want to do this over your head. So the two of you should sit together and talk this through. Mainly some feedback towards how thoroughly important pieces of work need to be done. Some really important requirements were missing and others weren’t precise enough. I fixed it MYSELF because we lacked the time, but that’s obviously not how I want to spend my time. So no consequences this time, but it's something that should be communicated.
Talk to you soon,
Thomas

I just arrived back in Hamburg just to have B.R. calling me.
He was really excited and kept telling me how great the analytical side of our CRM would certainly be.
How could you commit to that without checking in with me first? This is WAY out of scope for the current budget, you’re putting the whole project at risk.
Let me be clear that I am not happy about this, but now we will have to deal with this fait accompli.
As far as I know, there’s a budget meeting scheduled with Gundula Eberle next week anyway. MAKE SURE to get additional funding for this, otherwise we’re between a rock and a hard place.
Hang in there,
Thomas
